STATIC_heading.text: REVIEW SHEET

STATIC_text.text: Write the meanings of the word parts in the spaces provided and test yourself. Check your answers with the information in the chapter or in the Glossary (Medical Word Parts—English) at the end of the book.
Instructions: Click or tap on the plus sign to reveal the opposite side of the card.

header.title: -agon

readingPart.reading: assemble, gather

readingPart.reading: removal; excision; resection

readingPart.reading: blood condition

header.title: -genic

readingPart.reading: produced by or in

readingPart.reading: substance

readingPart.reading: enlargement

header.title: -oid

readingPart.reading: resembling; originating from

readingPart.reading: condition, usually abnormal

readingPart.reading: to grow

readingPart.reading: stopping; controlling; placing

readingPart.reading: labor; birth (a substance for)

header.title: eu-

readingPart.reading: good; normal; true

header.title: hyper-

readingPart.reading: above; excessive

header.title: hypo-

readingPart.reading: deficient; below; under; less than

readingPart.reading: rapid; sharp; acid

header.title: pan-

readingPart.reading: all

header.title: poly-

readingPart.reading: many; much; increased

header.title: tetra-

readingPart.reading: four

header.title: tri-

questionContent.questionText:
ENDOCRINE GLAND: Adrenal cortex

HYPERSECRETION:

[adrenal virilism/Cushing syndrome]

[Cushing syndrome/adrenal virilism]

HYPOSECRETION:

[Addison disease]

ENDOCRINE GLAND: Thyroid gland

HYPERSECRETION:

[exophthalmic goiter/Graves disease/thyrotoxicosis]

[nodular goiter/adenomatous goiter]

HYPOSECRETION:

[cretinism/endemic goiter/myxedema]

[endemic goiter/cretinism/myxedema]

[myxedema/cretinism/endemic goiter]

instructions.instructions: Fill in the following chart of pathologic conditions of endocrine glands and check your answers with Table 18-4.

questionContent.questionText:
1. test to assess glucose control [A1C]

2. sodium—an important electrolyte [Na+]

3. thyroxine [T4]

4. pregnancy hormone [hCG/HCG]

5. potassium—an important electrolyte [K+]
